intro: Lamium maculatum subvar. parviflorum, commonly known as the spotted deadnettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with distinctive purple and white markings, and it produces small, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, shady environments. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions. The subspecies parviflorum is distinguished by its smaller flowers compared to other varieties of Lamium maculatum.
